Compare Task Adapter with other systems

Some options you might consider for integrating

Microsoft Project and systems like Atlassian JIRA, Redmine, MantisBT, etc:

**Product** ### Task Adapter The Connector Redmine's "Microsoft Project import/export" plugin
**Architecture** A stand-alone desktop application running on Java (which is included in the distributives for Windows and Linux).No additional plugins are required to be installed into bug tracking systems or Microsoft project. A plugin for Microsoft Project.Requires installation of "web services" module to Atlassian JIRA server plus installation of Microsoft .NET framework on the client computer. A plugin for Redmine. Needs to be copied to the Redmine server.
**Supported systems**
    * Microsoft Project * Atlassian JIRA * Redmine * Github * MantisBT
    * Microsoft Project * Atlassian JIRA
    * Microsoft Project * Redmine
**Features**
    * Transfer tasks between any of the supported systems (e.g. Atlassian JIRA and Redmine) * Update existing Microsoft project files with the current data in your bug tracker.
    * Load tasks from / save to Atlassian JIRA and Microsoft Project * Update existing Microsoft project files with the current data in Atlassian JIRA.
    * Load tasks from / save to Redmine and Microsoft Project
**Price** $350 / 1 user $950 / 5 users License for 1 year with support and upgrades. $499 / 1 user $1999 / 5 users 1 year of support and free upgrades. FREE. No support.
**Documentation** Basic documentation (work in progress...) High-quality documentation is available. No documentation.
**Known limitations** Does not support non-interactive "scheduled transfer" in the current version, but we're working on this. Does not support non-interactive "scheduled transfer". Lots of bugs and compatibility issues; very limited functionality; conflicts with some other Redmine plugins. In fact Task Adapter project was started because that plugin didn't do what we needed.
